Serena Jeanine Hoy and James Dalton Reilly were married last evening at St. John's College in Annapolis, Md. Judge Merrick B. Garland of the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit officiated.

The bride, 35, is keeping her name. She is a legal counsel in Washington to Senator Harry Reid of Nevada, the majority leader. She graduated from the University of Arizona and received a master's degree in modern Middle Eastern studies from Oxford University in England, where she was a Rhodes scholar, and a law degree from Yale.

She is a daughter of Peggy and Kenneth Hoy of Maryville, Tenn. Her father retired as a information systems manager at McDonnell Douglas, the aircraft manufacturer and military contractor in St. Louis. Her mother is an admissions coordinator at Blount Memorial Hospital Transitional Care Center in Maryville.

The bridegroom, 39, works in Washington as the chief of staff for Senator Tom Carper, Democrat of Delaware. He graduated from the University of Delaware and received a master's degree in environmental management from Duke.

He is a son of Alice Reilly of Wilmington, Del., and the late James Reilly. His mother is a registered nurse for Delaware Hospice in Wilmington. His father retired as a vice president of human resources for the DuPont Company in Wilmington.
